trans-unit.source: Represents information about a character hit within a glyph run.
The CharacterHit structure provides information about the index of the first character that got hit as well as information about leading or trailing edge.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.CharacterHit"></xref> structure.
Index of the first character that got hit.
In the case of a leading edge, this value is 0.
In the case of a trailing edge, this value is the number of code points until the next valid caret position.
Determines whether the specified object is equal to the current <xref href="System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.CharacterBufferReference"></xref> object.
The object to compare with the current <xref href="System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.CharacterBufferReference"></xref> object.
if obj is equal to the current object; otherwise, .
If obj is not a object, is returned.

Determines whether the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.CharacterBufferReference"></xref> is equal to the current <xref href="System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.CharacterBufferReference"></xref> object.

The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.CharacterBufferReference"></xref> to compare with the current <xref href="System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.CharacterBufferReference"></xref> object.
if obj is equal to the current object; otherwise, .
Gets the index of the first character that got hit.
An <xref:System.Int32> value that represents the index.
Serves as a hash function for <xref href="System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.CharacterBufferReference"></xref>.
It is suitable for use in hashing algorithms and data structures such as a hash table.
An <xref:System.Int32> value that represents the hash code for the current object.
Compare two <xref href="System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.CharacterBufferReference"></xref> strings for equality.
The first instance of <xref href="System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.CharacterBufferReference"></xref> to compare.
The second instance of <xref href="System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.CharacterBufferReference"></xref> to compare.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> when the values of <xref:System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.CharacterHit.FirstCharacterIndex*> and <xref:System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.CharacterHit.TrailingLength*> properties are equal for both objects; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Compare two <xref href="System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.CharacterBufferReference"></xref> strings for inequality.
The first instance of <xref href="System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.CharacterBufferReference"></xref> to compare.
The second instance of <xref href="System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.CharacterBufferReference"></xref> to compare.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> when the values of <xref:System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.CharacterHit.FirstCharacterIndex*> and <xref:System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.CharacterHit.TrailingLength*> properties are equal for both objects; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>.
Gets the trailing length value for the character that got hit.
In the case of a leading edge, this value is 0.
In the case of a trailing edge, this value is the number of code points until the next valid caret position.
An <xref:System.Int32> value that represents the trailing length.
